title: How to Install Android on Raspberry Pi - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s possible to use Google Voice to make and receive calls, and use text messaging. Integrating smartphone computer functions is just a matter of the right software—so long as you have Wifi access. That being said—I’ve heard that installing Android on a Raspberry Pi is difficult. If you want to actually register your Raspberry Pi with a carrier and use it without wifi limitations, you’ll need to connect it to a GSM modem, with its inherent speed and bandwidth limitations.

How to Install Android on Raspberry Pi ?Installing Android OS is very easy on Raspberry Pi. It must be installed on a SD-Card usually a 4GB card to enable the installation of other apps and media files. The Android UI is still buggy on Raspberry Pi and crashes a lot and is very slow. Hence it is recommendable to install the OS only on the version of Raspberry Pi with memory of 512 MB or more.
